thread.title: Hillsdale Academy to play for District crown
thread.title_full: Hillsdale Academy to play for District crown

title: Hillsdale Academy to play for District crown
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 8:20 AM Updated at 8:20 AM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 8:20 AM Hillsdale, Mich. Hillsdale Academy to play for District crown KALAMAZOO â€“ 'Resilient' may best describe the 2015 Hillsdale Academy soccer team. On Wednesday, at Kalamazoo Christian High School, the Colts fell behind, not once, not twice, but three times. to the host Comets in Division 4, District 52, Regional 13 play. However, when the dust settled on the pitch, it was Hillsdale Academy on top 6-5 via an overtime win. "That's kind of been the script for this team throughout the year unfortunately. We don't seem to start out very hot, or really aggressive early on," Hillsdale varsity coach Neal Brady said. "But then we gain our focus, and we seem to take care of things and get the job done." With the win, Hillsdale Academy faces Kalamzaoo Hackett on Friday, at 4 p.m., for the District championship. The winning goal came off the toe of Teddy Wood, at 4:06 of the second 10 minute overtime period. Tie games are decided by two 10 minute extra-periods in post-season. Hillsdale trailed 2-0 early in the match, and after rallying to tie it at 2-2, the Colts fell behind a second time, 3-2. That score stood at halftime. Also proving the hero for Hillsdale, Nolan Sullivan got the tying goal, knotting the score in regulation at 5-5. "It was a great shot from about 20 yards out off a throw in," Brady said. "He was able to receive, turn, get it back and shoot and score." Wood also scored one minute into the second half if regulation. Also scoring goals for Hillsdale Academy were Sam Brady, Peter Kalthoff, who headed one in, and Will Smith. In goal, Lukas Tharp made 14 saves, including play in overtime. Brady also lauded the defensive play of Logan Tharp. Of the finals, coach Brady said. "It will be a tough match, but we just have to go out and lay it all on the line and play tough." Kalamazoo Hackett is ranked No. 6 in Division 4. Hillsdale Academy take a 16-3 record into the match. Hillsdale Academy won a District championship in 2009, and the Colts last played in the District Finals in 2013. FOOTBALL STANDINGS
